CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Initial Contact stage positioned above or below the Lead Captured stage?
SRP.A: The Initial Contact stage is positioned {below} the Lead Captured stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {exponential} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Needs Analysis?
VE.A: The value of stage Needs Analysis is {466}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Contract Signed?
VE.A: The value of stage Contract Signed is {264}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Negotiation?
VE.A: The value of stage Negotiation is {300}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Lead Captured, with a value of {806}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Contract Signed, with a value of {264}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Lead Captured to stage Initial Contact?
SC.A: Decreased by {192} Clients from stage Lead Captured to stage Initial Contact.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 391? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Lead Captured} stage has {806}, the {Initial Contact} stage has {614}, the {Needs Analysis} stage has {466}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 308? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Negotiation} stage has {300}, the {Contract Signed} stage has {264}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 308 and 391? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Proposal Sent to Negotiation, or from stage Initial Contact to Needs Analysis?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Initial Contact} to {Needs Analysis} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Needs Analysis to Proposal Sent, or from stage Negotiation to Contract Signed?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Needs Analysis} to {Proposal Sent} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Lead Captured to Initial Contact, from stage Negotiation to Contract Signed, or from stage Needs Analysis to Proposal Sent?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Lead Captured} to stage {Initial Contact} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Lead Captured} and {Initial Contact} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Proposal Sent} and {Negotiation} stages.
